greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse Euler transform of A005169 (fountains of coins).
comment: If G005169(x) = Sum_{i>=0} A005169(n)*x^n is the generating function of A005169, the a(n) are defined through G005169(x) = Product_{n>=1} 1/(1-x^n)^a(n), the inverse Euler transform of A005169.
reference: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, p. 381.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4178
R. K. Guy, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, Sep 25 1986.
R. K. Guy, Letter to N. J. A. Sloane, 1987
R. K. Guy, The strong law of small numbers. Amer. Math. Monthly 95 (1988), no. 8, 697-712.
R. K. Guy, The strong law of small numbers. Amer. Math. Monthly 95 (1988), no. 8, 697-712. [Annotated scanned copy]
mathematica: A005169 = Series[1 - Fold[Function[1 - x^#2/#1], 1, Range[max, 0, -1]], {x, 0, max}] // CoefficientList[#, x]&;

EULERi[b_] := Module[{a, c, i, d}, c = {}; For[i = 1, i <= Length[b], i++, c = Append[c, i*b[[i]] - Sum[c[[d]]*b[[i - d]], {d, 1, i - 1}]]]; a = {}; For[i = 1, i <= Length[b], i++, a = Append[a, (1/i)*Sum[mob[i, d]*c[[d]], {d, 1, i}]]]; Return[a]];
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 26 2013
